page.title: 08ARELEY KINGS CHURCH
page.content: This is one of the oldest buildings in the area.There is reference to it as far back as the 12th Century in the works of{Layaman.}This famous monk by tradition lived as a hermit in the Redstone Caves,some mile down river from the present bridge. {The Hermitage}cut into the great sandstone cliff was in use throughout the centuries especially as it lay at the{Redstone crossing of the River {Severn. The church was restored in Victorian times by Rector Daniel Vawdrey.The {Norman chancel and the 14th Century {tower}were unaltered.
